title: Speaker Johnson Pushes GOP-Only Border Bill While Talks Hit Impasse
description: Prospects for a bipartisan deal on immigration dimmed Wednesday as House Speaker Mike Johnson dug in on Republican legislation that Democrats argue goes too far in securing the US border with Mexico.

title: Labour Leader Keir Starmer Fires Starting Gun on UK ‘Election Year’
description: Labour leader Keir Starmer will make his opening pitch to voters in what is widely expected to be a UK election year, declaring that Britain is “crying out for change” after 14 years of Conservative governments.

title: Trump Asks US Supreme Court to Overturn Colorado Ballot Ban
description: Donald Trump asked the US Supreme Court to overturn a ruling that would bar him from the presidential ballot in Colorado, according to a person familiar with the filing, setting up a historic showdown over contentions that he forfeited his right to run again by inciting the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot.

title: Congress Makes Progress on Spending But Still Stuck on Immigration
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at the status of two issues on the front burner at the Capitol. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Who Was Qassem Soleimani, the General Whose Grave Was the Site of Iran Blasts?
description: Qassem Soleimani, commander of Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps’ elite Quds Force, was the personification of the country’s projection of power abroad. His death in a US strike near Baghdad International Airport in 2020 continues to reverberate across the Middle East, where he helped make Iran a decisive regional player via a network of proxy militias. Four years later, as crowds gathered at his grave to mark the anniversary of his death, explosions killed almost 100 people; a senior Ira

title: US, Partners Warn Houthis Against Further Attacks in Red Sea
description: A dozen countries warned the Houthis, a Yemen-based rebel group backed by Iran, against continuing its attacks on shipping in the Red Sea, which have disrupted global commerce and triggered a limited military response from the US.

title: As a missile hits a Kyiv apartment building, survivors lose a lifetime's possessions in seconds
description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — With trembling hands and labored breath, Serhii Slobodiannyk meticulously searched his fire-damaged apartment, seeking to salvage any of his family's treasured belongings following a Russian missile attack on Kyiv.

title: Argentina Court Suspends Labor Reforms, Dealing Setback to Milei
description: Argentine President Javier Milei suffered his first judicial setback after the country’s national labor appeals court suspended a key portion of his emergency decree aimed at overhauling South America’s second-biggest economy.

title: GOP’s Stefanik Keeps Heat on Harvard After Helping to Topple President
description: Harvard University thought it was done with former student Elise Stefanik when it removed the congresswoman from an advisory board after she made comments supporting President Donald Trump’s false claims of fraud in the 2020 election.

title: Russia, Ukraine Welcome Release of Prisoners in Major Swap
description: Ukraine and Russia conducted the first major swap of prisoners since August, with Moscow highlighting the role of the United Arab Emirates in the negotiating process.

title: Iran Blasts That Killed More Than 100 Stoke New Mideast Tensions
description: Iran said “terror” attacks that killed more than 100 people in the central part of the country were carried out to punish its stance against Israel, the latest sign that the war between the Jewish state and Hamas risks widening into a broader regional conflict.

title: Sierra Leone Charges Ex-President Koroma With Treason Over Foiled Coup
description: Sierra Leone’s former President Ernest Bai Koroma was charged with treason over his alleged involvement in a failed attempt by the security forces to overthrow the government in November.

title: Greek Premier Mitsotakis Starts 2024 With Ministerial Reshuffle
description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis began the year with a minor overhaul of his cabinet, with the main change coming at the citizen protection ministry following a recent spate of violence at sporting events.

title: Rishi Sunak Faces UK Watchdog Probe Over Asylum Backlog Claim
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s claim to have cleared the UK’s backlog of asylum cases is being looked at by the country’s statistics watchdog, amid accusations from opposition politicians that he misled voters.

title: Poland’s Tusk Is Planning UK Visit and May Meet Investors
description: Poland’s Premier Donald Tusk may meet investors during a possible visit in London as the new government seeks to boost this year’s budget spending.

title: Houthis Claim Yet Another Attack on a Container Ship in Red Sea
description: Houthi militants claimed to have attacked another merchant ship in the Red Sea, serving as a reminder of the threat they pose to a vital trade artery.

title: Nikki Haley’s Campaign Says She Raised $24 Million in Fourth Quarter
description: Former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley’s campaign said that she raised $24 million in the final three months of 2023 riding a wave of momentum in her bid for the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Watchdog Investigates Accountant Over Bankrupt UK Council
description: The UK’s audit and accountancy regulator has opened an investigation into an accountant following solar farm investments made by a now bankrupt local authority.

title: Erdogan’s Son-in-Law, Man Behind Turkey’s War Drones, Remains Nation’s Top Taxpayer
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s son-in-law who rose to prominence over production of combat drones has preserved his title as the nation’s top taxpayer for a second year.

title: Striking Out: Doctors' Walkout Gives Sunak Health Headache
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Farage Still Pondering Election Role, Reform UK Chief Tice Says
description: Nigel Farage is still pondering what role he’ll play in the next UK general election, Reform UK leader Richard Tice said, as he promised his party — which was co-founded by the right-wing Brexit figurehead — won’t cut a deal with the ruling Conservatives to stand aside in some seats in the next general election.

title: Ethiopia to Assess Somaliland Recognition Under Sea Access Deal
description: Ethiopia said its deal with Somaliland to gain access to the Red Sea allows the government to make an “in-depth assessment” toward deciding whether it would grant recognition to the breakaway region of Somalia.

title: Explosions Near Grave of Slain Iran Commander Soleimani Leave 20 Dead
description: Two explosions near the grave of Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani killed at least 20 people, state TV reported.

title: Libya’s Top Oil Field Halts Production Following Protests
description: Libya’s largest oil field halted production after protesters entered the facility, according to a person with direct knowledge of the operations.

title: Is 2024 the Year US-China Tensions Finally Trip Up Apple?
description: The iPhone maker has navigated its relationship with Beijing well so far, but the situation isn’t getting any easier.

title: Biden Pivots to 2024 With Speeches at Valley Forge and Charleston Church
description: President Joe Biden will take aim at his top Republican challengers, Donald Trump and Nikki Haley, with back-to-back events highlighting their vulnerabilities in a general election contest.

title: Italy Weighs $1 Billion Package to Boost Electric-Vehicle Sales
description: The Italian government is considering a €930 million ($1 billion) plan to encourage people to turn in their gasoline or diesel cars and buy electric vehicles instead, according to a draft document seen by Bloomberg.

title: US, Philippines Hold Fresh Sea Drills Amid China Tensions
description: The Philippine and US militaries on Wednesday began their second maritime drills in the South China Sea in less than two months amid continuing tensions with China in the disputed waters.

title: Egypt Hikes Prices With Government Eyeing Bigger IMF Loan
description: Egyptian officials kicked off the new year by raising prices for a range of key services, heaping new pressure on consumers as the government looks to raise revenue and potentially boost the size of its rescue package from the International Monetary Fund.

title: Iran Suspends Relaunch of Saudi Flights in Setback For Detente
description: Iran’s flag carrier Iran Air suspended plans to restart flights to Saudi Arabia after an eight-year hiatus, in a setback for one of the few concrete signs of the countries’ political detente.

title: Thai PM Says Policy Rate Decisions Must Factor in Economic Risks
description: Thailand’s central bank should take into account the risks the nation’s economy faces including its fragile recovery when deciding monetary policy, according to Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin.

title: Poland Calls for Tighter Sanctions on Russia After Air Strikes
description: Poland’s Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski has called on Western allies to tighten sanctions on Russia and to supply Kyiv with long-range missiles in response to the latest series of air strikes.

title: England’s Junior Doctors Hold Longest Ever Strike, Putting Strain on NHS
description: Britain’s state-run health service faces another crisis as junior doctors stage the longest strike in its history, at a time of intense pressure on hospitals and clinics.

title: Greek Radical Leftists Bet on a Goldman Alum Isn’t Working Out
description: The Greek opposition’s new leader has less than half a year to win over voters in European Union elections – but before that he has to convince his own party. The prospects for either are looking murky.

title: Taiwan Spots Four Chinese Balloons Over Island as Poll Nears
description: A flurry of Chinese weather balloons crossed Taiwan for the first time since the island began releasing such data, as tensions with Beijing flare ahead of the self-ruled democracy’s presidential election this month.

title: Stabbed South Korean Opposition Leader Recovering After Surgery
description: South Korea’s main opposition party leader Lee Jae-myung is recovering from surgery a day after getting stabbed in the neck by an assailant during a visit to the southern coastal city of Busan.

title: China Sacks Top Official After Game Rules Backlash, Reuters Says
description: Beijing has removed a top official who oversaw China’s gaming industry, Reuters reported, suggesting the government is trying to tamp down a backlash against harsh new regulations that triggered an $80 billion rout across major tech stocks.
